caldav.googleAuthStarted: Google authorization opened in browser. Complete the sign-in to connect.
caldav.googleSetupHelp: To set up Google Calendar integration:
caldav.googleStep1: 1. Go to the Google Cloud Console and create a project (or select an existing one).
caldav.googleStep2: 2. Enable the CalDAV API: navigate to APIs & Services > Library, search for "CalDAV API", and enable it.
caldav.googleStep3: 3. Configure the OAuth consent screen: go to APIs & Services > OAuth consent screen, set user type to "External", and fill in the required fields.
caldav.googleStep4: 4. Add your Google email as a test user under the consent screen's "Test users" section (required while the app is in testing mode).
caldav.googleStep5: 5. Create OAuth credentials: go to APIs & Services > Credentials > Create Credentials > OAuth client ID. Select "Web application" and add your Fulcrum callback URL as an authorized redirect URI.
caldav.googleStep6: 6. Copy the Client ID and Client Secret into the fields above and click Connect.
caldav.googleFillRequired: Client ID and Client Secret are required
caldav.helpIntro: Enter your CalDAV server URL and credentials. Common server URLs:
caldav.helpNote: For Google Calendar, use the Google Calendar tab with OAuth2 authentication.
